Appendix: Data

In this appendix are given all 1,077 cognate sets used in reconstructing the Common Gàn (CG) sound system. The sets are arranged alphabetically by Modern Standard Chinese pronunciation of the example syllables, as spelled in the pīnyīn system. At the head of each set Qièyùn System (QYS) forms are supplied in the orthography of Bernhard Karlgren as slightly modified by F. K. Li. The QYS forms are given merely for ease of reference to the traditional classificatory framework and play no role in the reconstructions. In addition, Common Dialectal Chinese (CDC; Norman 2006, Ms. 1) forms are given for each set; and in some cases Early Chinese (EC; Norman 1994, 2014, Ms. 1) are also supplied. The twenty-six dialect points in each set are discussed in §1.3 and §1.5 of Chapter I. For certain sets, brief notes on irregular forms and problematic correspondences are added. For detailed treatment of these points, see the pertinent sections of Chapters II, III, and IV. As noted in §1.1 and §1.4 of Chapter I, competing CG forms are posited for sets where parallel variant readings are present at two or more dialect points.

ài  艾 QYS  ngâi-

CDC *ngoi6

TS [ŋa陽去]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [ŋai陽去];

TC [ŋai陽去]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1

[ŋai陽去]; DC2 [—];

AY [ŋai陽去]; NC

[ŋai陽去]; FX

[ŋai陽去]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [ŋai去]; AF1 [—]; AF2

[ŋai去];

LH1 [—]; LH2 [ai陽去 ~ ŋai陽去];

JA1 [ŋai去];

JA2 [ŋai陰去];

SC [—]; LnC [ŋai陽去]; NnC1

[ŋai陽去]; NnC2

[—]; LC [ŋai陽去]

CG *ŋai陽去

The upper register tone in the JA2 form is irregular.

bào  抱 QYS  bâu:

The finals of the CL and JA1 forms irregular and may reflect the influence of the Modern Standard Chinese koine. The LH1 tone is irregular.

bié  別 QYS  pjät3, bjät3

CDC *biat8 ~ *piat7

TS [pi陽去]; WN1 [pjɛʔ陽入]; WN2 [biɛʔ陽入]; WN3 [piet陽入];

[biɛl陽入2];

TC [biɛʔⁿ入];

XZ [biɛ陽去]; YX [bʰiɛʔ陰平]; DC1 [biet陽入]; DC2

AY [p'iɛʔ陽入];

NC [p'iɛt陽入];

FX [p'ieʔ陰入 ~ p'ieʔ陽入]; GA [pʰiɛl陽入];

CL  [p'ie入];

PX  [p'iɛ去];  AF1  [pʰie去];  AF2

[pʰie陽平];

LH1

[pʰie去];

LH2

[pʰiɛ陽去];  JA1

[pʰiɛ去]; JA2

[p'iɛ陽去];

SC [pʰiɛ陽去];

LnC [p'iɛt陽入];

NnC1 [p'ieʔ入]; NnC2 [p'iɛʔ入];

LC [p'iɛʔ陽入] CG *biet陽入

The WN3 form is irregular, for it appears to derive from an earlier *piet but is nonetheless in lower register. The the YX tone is quite irregular. It is almost certainly a misprint in the source, since yīnpíng tone syllables cannot take final glottal stop in this dialect.

CG *biŋ陽去

~ piŋ陰去

Two different etyma are represented in this set. Some dialects and dialect sources distinguish

372

Appendix: Data

them. Others do not. The final of the LC form is irregular. We should expect final -ŋ here.

373

A Study of Comparative Gàn

AY [pət陰入]; NC

[pət陰入]; FX

[pət陰入]; GA [pøl陰入]*;

CL [pu入]**; PX

[ŋ陽平 ~ pu陰平];

AF1 [pu陰平]; AF2 [po陰平];

LH1 [pe陰平]***;

LH2 [pɛ陰平];

JA1 [po平]; JA2

[pu陰平];

SC [—]***; LnC [put陰入]; NnC1 [puʔ入文 ~ piʔ入白]; NnC2 [piʔ入]; LC [piʔ陰入]* CG *put陰入文 *Usual verbal negative is [ŋ̩陽平].

**Usual verbal negative is [ŋ̩陰去].

***Usual verbal negative is atonal [ŋ̩].

Only the wén reading of this word can confidently be reconstructed for Common Gàn as a whole. An unstressed bái reading of this negative, in dialects that actually use it in speech, may phonetically have been something like [pət] or [pɤt].

[t'ɛʔ陰入 ~ sɿ陰入] CG *ts'ek陰入

~ *ts'ɿ陰去

*JXFY. Tone missing.

The yīnshǎng tonal reading for the first reconstruction is conjectural, since the determinative dialects have only the second form.

[ʈʰa陰平]; JA2

[t'a陰平];

[tɕi陰平文 ~ t'a陰平白]; NnC1

[t'a陰平]; NnC2

[t'a陰平]; LC

[ts'a陰平] CG *tʂ'ia陰平白

~*tʂ'ie陰平文 ~ *ky陰平文

In this set, wén readings ending in -e and -ɛ can probably be derived from loan forms in *-ie. The second wén reconstruction is a reading pronunciation, reflected in FX and LnC. In actual speech, it occurs in the name of a chess piece.

chéng  盛 QYS  źjäng

CDC *zhiang2 ~ *jiang2

TS [—]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [—];

TC [—]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [ʂaŋ陽平]; DC2 [—];

AY [t'əŋ陽平]; NC [sən陰去]; FX [—]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [—]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [—]; LH1 [—]; LH2 [—]; JA1 [sin上];

JA2 [ɕin陽平];

SC [—]; LnC [sin陽平]; NnC1 [—]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—] CG *ʂiŋ陽平文

The DC1 form points to an earlier *ʂiaŋ陽平, while the AY form must come from *dʐiŋ陽平.

382

Appendix: Data

However, these forms cannot be reconstructed comparatively due to scantness of the data.

chéng  程 QYS  ḍjäng

CDC *jiang2

TS [tsɐn陽平]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [tɕin陽平]; WN3 [—];

TC

[dzən陽平];

[dʐaŋ陽平];

[t'ən陽平];

[tʰøn陽平文 ~ tsʰaŋ上白];

[tɕ'ẽ陽平];

PX

[tʂ'əŋ陽平 ~ t'aŋ陽平];  AF1  [tʰẽn陽平];

AF2  [tʰin去];

[tsʰẽ陽平];

[tsʰen陽平]; JA1

[ʈʰin上]; JA2 [—];

[tsʰɛ͂n陽平];

LnC  [t'in陽平文 ~ t'aŋ陽平白];  NnC1

[t'aŋ陽平];  NnC2

[tɕ'in陽平文 ~ t'aŋ陽平白];

LC

[ts'aŋ陽平] CG *dʐiaŋ陽平白 ~ *dʐiŋ陽平文

The GA bái reading and the AF2 form are tonally irregular. The AY initial is irregular.

chī

喫 QYS

(khjət), khiek

CDC *khiak7

TS [tɕ'iɒ入]; WN1

[tɕhjɑʔ陰入];

WN2 [tɕʰiaʔ陰入];

WN3 [tɕ'iak陰入];

TC [dʑiaʔ入]; XZ

[dʑia陰去2]; YX [dʑʰiaʔ陰入2]; DC1 [dʑiak低入]; DC2

[iak陰入2];

AY

[tɕ'iaʔ陰入];

NC [tɕ'iak陰入];

FX [tɕ'iʔ陰入文 ~ tɕ'iaʔ陰入白]; GA [ɕiaʔ陰入];

CL

[tɕ'ia入]; PX [tɕ'ia陰平]; AF1 [tɕʰia陰平]; AF2

[tɕʰia陰平]; LH1

[tɕʰia陰平];

LH2 [tɕʰia陰平];

JA1 [tɕʰia平]; JA2 [—];

SC

[tɕʰia陰平];

LnC [tɕ'iʔ陰入文 ~ tɕ'iaʔ陰入白]; NnC1

[t'aʔ入]; NnC2

[t'aʔ入]; LC

[tɕ'iaʔ陰入]

CG

*k'iak陰入 (?)

This set has the typical correspondence signature pattern for *k'- before *-i-, with the exception of the LC form, where we would expect initial k'- rather than a palatal. The reason for this is uncertain. It is possible that the LC form has been borrowed from some other neighboring or more prestigious Gàn dialect.

chǐ  齒 QYS  tśhï:

CDC *chi3

TS [ts'ɿ上]; WN1 [—];

WN2 [tsʰɿ上];

WN3 [ts'ɿ上];

TC [dzɿ上]; XZ

[dʐʅ上];

YX [dʐʰʅ上];

DC1 [—]; DC2 [dʐʅ上];

AY [t'ə上]; NC

[ts'ɿ上];

FX [t'ə上]; GA

[tʰø上];

CL [tʂ'ʅ上]; PX

[tʂ'ʅ上];

AF1

[tʰə陰上];

AF2 [tʰe上];

LH1

[tsʰɿ上];

LH2 [tsʰɿ陰平];

JA1

[ʈø上];

JA2 [t'ə上];

SC [tsʰɿ陰上]; LnC [t'i上]; NnC1 [tɕ'i上];

NnC2 [tɕ'i上]; LC [tɕ'i上]

CG *tʂ'i陰上

The WN2 form is given as [tsʰi上] in the source. We suspect a misprint, since this is an impossible syllable type in this dialect.The JA1 form irregularly lacks aspiration. The LH2 tone is irregular.

chǒng  寵 QYS

ṭhjwong:

CDC *chiung3

TS [ts'ɐŋ上]; WN1

[—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [tɕ'iŋ上];

TC [nəŋ上]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [tʂuŋ上]; DC2 [—];

AY [t'əŋ上]; NC [ts'uŋ上]; FX

[t'ɯŋ上]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [tʂ'əŋ上]; AF1

[—];

AF2

[tʰəŋ陰上];

LH1 [—];

LH2 [tɕʰyŋ上]; JA1 [ʈʰəŋ上];

JA2 [t'uŋ上];

SC [—]; LnC [t'uŋ上]; NnC1

[t'uŋ上]; NnC2 [—];

LC [ts'uŋ上] CG *tʂ'iuŋ陰上

The TC form is irregular. It seems possible that the word has been read off from the graphic form 寵 according to its phonetic element, lóng 龍, whose pronunciation in this dialect is [nəŋ陽平].

385

A Study of Comparative Gàn

chōu  抽 QYS  ṭhjəu

CDC *chieu1

TS [ts'ɑu陰平];

[tʰɛu陰平];

The YX tone is irregular. We should expect yīnpíng-2.

CG *dzəu陽平 ~

*səu陽平 (?)

The tone of the YX form may be a typographical error for yángpíng. The final of the second reconstruction is posited by analogy with the first and is therefore conjectural.

chòu  臭 QYS  tśhjəu-

[t'u陰去]; GA

[tʰɛu陰去];

~ *tʂ'iu上

The tone of the DC2 form is unexpectedly of the lower register. That of the second reconstruction is unetymological.

Appendix: Data

[tʰy陽平]; LH1 [tɕʰy陽平];  LH2 [tɕʰy陽平];

[ʈʰy去]; JA2 [t'y陽平];

SC [—]; LnC [t'u陽平]; NnC1 [—]; NnC2

[tɕ'y陽平]; LC [tɕ'y陽平] CG *dʐy陽平

387

A Study of Comparative Gàn

chǔ  楚 QYS  tṣhjwo:

CDC *che3 (~ *chu3)

chù  處 QYS  tśhjwo-

AY [t'u上] tone regular; NC

[tɕ'y上]; FX [t'u陰去]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [tʂ'ʯ去]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [—]; LH1 [—]; LH2 [—]; JA1 [ʈʰy去]; JA2 [t'y上]; SC [—]; LnC [t'u去]; NnC1 [tɕ'y陰去]; NnC2 [—]; LC [tɕ'y陰去文 ~ tɕ'iɛ陰去白] CG *tʂ'y陰去 The LC bái form reflects an archaic Common Gàn *tʂ'ie陰去白, for which we lack other comparative evidence in our data.

[t'iuŋ

]  CG

SC  [tɕʰiə̃

];  LnC

[tɕ'iuŋ

陽平

陽平

陽平

陽平

陽平

*dziuŋ陽平 ~ *dzuŋ陽平

A CG form *dziuŋ陰平 can be posited on the basis of the FX and GA data. This is a literary form which is limited to the compound cōngróng 從容 “at ease, free and easy”.

cū  粗 QYS

tshuo

CDC *tshu1

TS [ts'ɑu陰平];

[dzʰɿ陰平2];

TC [dzən陰平];

[dzʰen陰平2]; DC1 [dzən陰平];

[ts'ən陰平];

[t'o陰去]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—]

CG *ts'o陰去 ~ *ts'o上

This set is heavily mixed. The LC form may descend from an earlier *ts'ok陰去, which would agree with the Common Dialectal Chinese and QYS forms.

[tiʔ陽入]; WN2

[dia陰去2]; YX

[dʰi陽入]; DC1 [dik陽入];

[t'it陽入文 ~ liak陽入白 ~ liak陰入白];

[t'iʔ陽入文 ~ liaʔ陽入白];

CL [ti入]; PX [t'ia去]; AF1

[tʰia去];

AF2 [tʰia去];

LH2

[lia陽去];

JA1

[tie去]; JA2 [—];

SC

[tʰia陽去];

LnC  [tiʔ陽入文 ~ tiaʔ陽入白];

NnC1  [tiaʔ入];

NnC2  [t'iaʔ入];

LC

[tiaʔ陽入]

CG

*diak陽入 ~ *diek陽入 ~ *tiek陽入

397

A Study of Comparative Gàn

The third reconstructed form appears to represent a loan from a language in which both voicing and aspiration have been lost. This borrowing may have been very late, when the phonetic form of the loanword was actually *tiʔ, rather than *tiek. The LnC bái form irregularly lacks aspiration. It may have been contaminated by the wén reading. The initial of the WN3 form is irregular. It may have been borrowed from another dialect, such as DC2.

dì  地 QYS  di-

CDC *di6

TS

[tæi陽去];

WN1 [ti陽去]; WN2 [tʰi陽去]; WN3

[ti陽去];

TC

[di陽去];

XZ

[di陽去];

YX [dʰi陽去];

DC1 [di陽去]; DC2

[li陰平];

AY

[t'i陽去];

NC

[t'i陽去];

FX [t'i陽去];

GA [tʰi陽去];

CL

[t'i陽去];

PX [t'i去]; AF1 [tʰi去]; AF2 [tʰi去];

LH1 [tʰi去];

LH2

[tiau陰平]; JA1

[ti去 ~ tʰi去];

JA2

[t'i陽去];

SC [tʰi陽去];

LnC

[t'i陽去];

NnC1 [t'i陽去]; NnC2

[t'i陽去]; LC

[hi陽去]

CG *di陽去

The LH2 form is highly irregular and of unknown origin.

dì  弟 QYS  diei:

CDC *diai4

TS

[tæi陽去];

WN1 [ti陽去 ~ thi上]; WN2 [di陽去];

WN3 [t'i陽去];

TC

[di陽去];

The initial of the WN3 form is irregular.

The second form is etymologically obscure. It may derive from an otherwise unattested earlier reading in *di陽去.

*tiau陰去文 ~ *diau上

The stylistic register of the third reconstructed form is indeterminate. It is a bái form in TC but a wén reading in LnC. It is in also unetymological.

dòng  動 QYS

dung:

CDC *dung4

CG *duŋ陽上 ~ *duŋ陽去

The tone of the AF2 form is irregular. Those of the DC2 and the NnC2 bái forms are, on the other hand regular and are diagnostic for an earlier Common Gàn yángshǎng tone.

The vowel and tone of the AF2 form are irregular. The reading may be a loan from some dialect that had the main vowel -u- here. The vowel of the WN3 form is irregular.

é  鵝 QYS

CDC *nhi2/EC *ne

[ø上]; JA2

[œ陽平];

SC [ə陽平];

LnC

[ɘ陽平];

NnC1 [ø陽平]; NnC2 [ø陽平]; LC [ɵ陽平文 ~ ni白* ~ ŋɛ白]

CG (*ni白 ~

*ne白?) ~ *ɻi陽平 ~ *ɚ陽平

*Atonal noun suffix with morphophonemic variants in [i ~ mi ~ ŋi]. Atonal [ŋɛ], which is also a nominal suffix, occurring only after preceding -ŋ and competing with [ŋi] in this position, appears to be an even older archaic substrate form possibly derived from an underlying *ne or *ŋe.

LC forms may be irregular. The matter is uncertain, since the syllable

The Nánchéng-1 form is unique in the it combines the bilabial initial of one variant type with the yángqù tone of the other.

*kop陰入

*The source has ko, which is a misprint. The AF1 form is anomalous.

SC [hɵ陽去]; LnC [hop陽入]; NnC1 [høyʔ入]; NnC2 [høyʔ入]; LC [hop陽入] CG *hop陽入 ~ kop陰入 The second CDC form represents a word having the sense “unit of measure”. This form is represented in a number of the sources, where it is treated as a variant reading. This format is followed here for convenience.

灰 QYS  xuậi

huì

會 QYS  ɣuâi-

CDC *huoi6

TS [xuæi陽去]; WN1

[—]; WN2 [fi陽去]; WN3

[fi陽去];

TC

[fi陽去];

XZ

[fi陽去]; YX

[fi陽去 ~ vi陽去];

DC1 [ɸui陽去];

DC2 [ɸui陽去 ~ ui陽去];

AY

[fi陽去];

NC

[fəi陽去 ~ ui陽去];

FX [hui陽去 ~ ui陽去]; GA

[fai陽去 ~ uai陽去];

CL [xue陽去];

PX [fi去];

AF1 [fei去]; AF2

[fuɔi去]; LH1 [huœ去]; LH2 [føi陰去]; JA1 [fei去];

JA2

[fui陽去];

SC

[hui陽去 ~ uei陽去];

LnC [fəi陽去文 ~ uai陽去白];

NnC1 [fi陽去];  NnC2

[fi陽去文 ~ fɛi陽去白]; LC

[fəi陽去 ~ ui陽去文 ~ hai陽去白]

CG *huoi陽去 ~ *uoi陽去白 ~ *hui陽去文 ~ *ui陽去

This set is highly mixed, involving combinations of two sets of initials and finals. The derivation of the LC bái form is particularly uncertain, since it does not correspond regularly to any forms in the other dialects. In our view, the etymon represented here is actually xiè 解 (QYS ɣaï:/CDC *hai4) “(to understand >) know how, be able to”.

hūn  婚 QYS  xuən

CDC *xun1

TS [xuɐn陰平]; WN1 [hwən陰平];

WN2 [fən陰平]; WN3 [fən陰平];

TC [fən陰平]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [ɸun陰平]*; DC2 [—];

AY [fən陰平]; NC [fən陰平]; FX

[huən陰平]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [fəŋ陰平]; AF1 [fẽn陰平]; AF2 [fɛn陰平]; LH1 [fẽ陰平]; LH2

[fen陰平]; JA1

[fɛn平];

431

A Study of Comparative Gàn

JA2 [fen陰平];

SC [hũn陰平]; LnC [fən陰平]; NnC1 [fyn陰平]; NnC2 [—]**; LC [fən陰平]

CG *hun陰平

*Deduced from a lacuna in the source.

**Compare: 昏 [fin陰平].

CG *kai陰平

The TS wén form clearly represents a loan form *kiai陰平. However, no such form can be reconstructed comparatively for CG.

SC [tɕĩ陰平]; LnC [tɕim陰平];

*kin陰平

*JXFY.

The LC bái form has a very interesting rounded final, which is not found at our other points.

CG *ky陰去

The wén and bái designations for the GA forms appear to have been reversed in the source.

jù  鋸 QYS

kjwo-

CDC *kie5 (~ *kiu5)

TS [tɕy陰去文 ~ ki陰去白]; WN1 [—];

WN2 [kiɛ陰去]; WN3

[kɛ陰去];

TC [tɕy陰去文 ~ ke陰去白]; XZ

[kʉi陰去1

~ kɛ陰去1]; YX [kɛ陰去1];

DC1 [ke陰去白]; DC2

[kɛ陰去];

AY [kiɛ陰去];

FX [ki陰去 ~ tɕiɛ陰去];

GA

[kiɛ陰去];

CL  [tɕy陰去文 ~ ke陰去白];  PX

[kɛ去];

AF1  [tɕiɛ去];  AF2

[ky去];  LH1  [ke去];

LH2  [kiɛ陰平];

JA1 [kiɛ去];

JA2 [tɕy陰去];

SC [tɕy陽去];

LnC [tɕi陰去文 ~ ke陰去白]; NnC1 [kie陰去]; NnC2

[kiɛ陰去]; LC [kɛ陰去]

CG *ke陰去白

~ *kie陰去白 ~ *ky陰去文

Here we reconstruct Common Gàn *-e and *-ie as variant popular forms. Palatalization before the latter final occurs in some dialects but not in others, for uncertain reasons. The syllable *ky regularly yields modern kʉi in XZ.

447

A Study of Comparative Gàn

*JXFY.

jùn  菌 QYS

gjwen:3

CDC *giun4

TS [tɕyɐn陽去];

WN1 [—]; WN2 [tɕʰyn上];

WN3 [tɕ'yn上];

TC [tsən上]; XZ [gʉin陽去]; YX [dʑʰin陽去];

DC1 [tɕin上]; DC2

[tɕin上];

AY [tɕin上]; NC [—]; FX [—];

GA [tsʰøn陽去];

CL [tɕ'yẽ陽去];

PX [tʂ'ʯŋ上]; AF1

[tɕĩn陰平];

AF2 [tɕin陰上]; LH1 [kʰuẽ陰上]*;

LH2 [tɕyøn陰平];

JA1 [tsyn去]; JA2 [tɕyn上];

SC [tɕỹn陽上];

LnC [—]; NnC1 [tɕyn上]; NnC2 [tɕyn上]; LC [tɕyn陰平] CG *gyn陽上 ~ *gyn陽去

~ *kyn陽上 (sic!)

*JXFY: [tɕyẽ陰平].

This word has upper register tonal readings at various points. These are probably fairly late literary loans. The third reconstructed form may be a loan/blend from some form of Guānhuà. The LC form is almost certainly such a hybrid, probably based in some way on the Modern Standard Chinese koine. The syllabic shape of the LC form implies derivation from a Common Gàn *tsyn rather *kyn. The word is probably actually a late loan from some other dialect.

jùn  郡 QYS  gjuən-

lā  拉 QYS  ---

The final of the TC word is irregular and likely unrelated. The remaining items are probably intrusive and of northern origin.

CG *loi陽平 (~ *lei陽平 ?)

*The initial of the AF2 form is irregular.

The second reconstructed form is based on modern forms with a unique correspondence pattern. It may in fact simply be a special development after *l-.

[ly陽去]; WN3 [li陽去];

[li陽去];

[lui陽去文 ~ li陽去白];

[li去]; AF1 [ti去];

AF2 [luɔi去]; LH1

[li去]; LH2

[li陰去]; JA1 [luɔi去];

JA2

[lui陽去];

SC [lei陽去];

LnC [ti陽去]; NnC1

[—]; NnC2 [ty陽去];

LC [ti]*  CG *lyi陽去 ~ *luoi去

*Neutral tone.

The finals and tone of the GA forms are irregular. The first reading occurs in the syllabary section of the source, while the second is found in the lexical section, sub “lacrima”. The second reconstruction is supported by the AF2 and JA1 forms. These dialects do not distinguish upper and lower register for the qù tone.

lěng  冷 QYS  lɒng:

Appendix: Data

not provide direct evidence for this final element.

CG *lien陽去

The AY tone is irregular. The LnC final can only derive from Common Gàn *-yon, which, however, cannot be reconstructed here for lack of comparative evidence.

A Study of Comparative Gàn

[tiŋ陽去] CG *liŋ陽去 (~ *liaŋ陽去)

The AF2 form reflects an earlier *liaŋ陽去 that cannot be comparatively reconstructed.

[muai去]; JA2 [mui陰去];

SC [mei陰平];

LnC [mi陽去 ~ muoi陽去 ~ moi陽去]; NnC1

[mei陽去]; NnC2

[mɛi陽去];

LC [moi陽去]

CG *muoi陽去

The Jí'ān-2 form irregularly takes the yīnqù tone. This is oddly similar to Hakka, where the word usually also has this tone. There may be a connection of some sort.

mén  門 QYS  muən

měng  猛 QYS  mɒng:

CDC *mang4

TS [mɐŋ上]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [məŋ上];

CL  [mẽ上];

PX  [mẽ上];  AF1  [—];  AF2  [məŋ陰上];  LH1  [mẽ陰上];  LH2

[men陽去];  JA1

[məŋ上]; JA2

[men上];

SC [—]; LnC [men上]; NnC1 [men上]; NnC2 [mɛn上]; LC [mɛŋ上] CG *maŋ上白 ~ * meŋ陰上文 The register of the CG shǎng tone in the bái reading is indeterminate, since it does not occur in any of the determinative dialects.

The GA tone is irregular. An anonynous reviewer observes that in a different GA subvariety the word has the shǎng tone.

mù  墓 QYS  muo-

[məŋ去]; LH2

[məŋ去];

The LH1 and JA1 forms are anomalous. It seems possible that they are derived from an earlier *muŋ去.

mù  目 QYS  mjuk

A Study of Comparative Gàn

ná  拿 QYS  ṇa

(CDC *na2)

TS [nɒ陽平]; WN1

[—]; WN2 [la陰平];

WN3 [la陽平];

TC [na陰平]; XZ [na陽平]; YX [la陰平1];

DC1 [na陰平 ~ na陽平]; DC2 [na陽平1];

AY [laʔ陰入]; NC

[la陰去 ~ lak陰入]; FX

[la陽平]; GA

[laʔ陰入];

CL [la入];

PX [la陽平]; AF1 [la陰平]; AF2

[la陰平];

LH1 [la陽平文 ~ nã陰平白]; LH2

[la陽去]; JA1

[na平]; JA2

[na陽平];

SC [la陽平]; LnC

[la陽平]; NnC1 [na陰去];

NnC2 [na陽平]; LC [na陽平] CG *na陰平白 ~ *na陽平文

(~ *nak陰入 ?)

The first form appears to represent a native, or at least very old, Gàn etymon, while the second, whose tone agrees with the QYS reading, must be an importation. The third form is unique and may in fact represent an entirely different word from that embodied in the first two forms.

nǐ  你 QYS  nï:

CDC *ni4;

rǔ

CDC *nhie4

TS [næi上文 ~ n̩上白]; WN1

[ȵjɛ陽平]; WN2 [ȵiɛ陽平];

WN3 [ȵiɛ陽平];

TC [ni上文 ~ n̩上白]; XZ

[n̩上]; YX [n̩上]; DC1

[ni上文 ~ n̩陽去白];

DC2 [n̩上];

AY

[li上文 ~ n̩陽去白]; NC

[ȵi上文 ~ n̩上白];

FX [ȵi上];

GA [n̩陰去];

478

Appendix: Data

CL [ȵi陰平];

PX [hɛ去 ~ ȵi去];

AF1 [ȵi陽上];

AF2 [ni去]; LH1

[ŋ陽平];

LH2 [in陰平]; JA1 [ni上];

JA2 [ȵi上];

SC [ȵi陽上];

LnC [li上]; NnC1

[ni上 ~ ne上];

NnC2 [nɛ上]; LC

[nɛ上]

CG *nie (Tone ?) ~ *ni陽上

Syllabic nasal forms, together with those ending in modern -e, -ɛ, and -iɛ, derive from from a Common Gàn 汝 *nie, whose tone is indeterminate. Other forms derive from 你 *ni陽上, which was borrowed from some later, probably northern, source. The PX form hɛ去̃ and the LH2 form are of uncertain origin. Certain forms in this set, both bái and wén, point to earlier píngshēng or qùshēng readings. Their origins are obscure.

nì  膩 QYS  ṇi-

CDC *ni6

TS [ȵi陽去]; WN1

[—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [ȵit陰入];

TC [—]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [nie上]; DC2 [—]; AY [—]; NC [ȵi陽去]; FX [—]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [—]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [nie去]; LH1 [—]; LH2 [li陰平]; JA1 [nia去]; JA2 [—]; SC [—]; LnC [—]; NnC1 [ni陽去]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—] CG *ni陽去 ~ *nit陰入

The second reconstructed form, which is unetymological, can be reconstructed on the basis of the WN3 and AF2 readings. The DC1 and JA1 forms are of obscure origin.

The TS form and the TC bái form are anomalous, as is the tone of the LH1 bái form. The SC form reflects an earlier lower register tone reading.

niào  尿 QYS  nieu-

CDC *niau6/EC *'newh

TS [ȵiɛu陽去文 ~ sæi陽去白]; WN1

[—]; WN2 [ȵiau陽去]; WN3

[ȵiɑu陽去];

[iau陰去]; JA1

[niau去]; JA2

[ȵiau陽去];

SC  [ȵiau陽去];

NnC2  [nau陽去];

LC  [niau陽去]

CG *niau陽去

*JXFY.

The TS bái form is a different etymon from that found elsewhere in the set. It may be related in some way to the form suī 尿 “urine”, which is found in various dialect families.

480

Appendix: Data

niú  牛 QYS  ngjəu

Appendix: Data

[pʰaŋ平]; JA2 [p'en陽平文 ~ p'ɐŋ陽平白];

not provide direct evidence for this final element. The NnC1 tone is irregular.

487

A Study of Comparative Gàn

JA2 [tɕ'i陽平];

SC [—]; LnC [ts'i陽平]; NnC1 [tɕ'i陽平]; NnC2 [tɕ'i陽平]; LC [t'i陽平] CG *dzi陽平

The GA tone is irregular. A reviewer reports for another GA variety the reading [tsʰɛi陽平]. This form presumably derives from CG *ts'ei2, which we are unable to reconstruct comparatively.

[k'i上]

CG *k'i陽去 ~ k'i陰上

The initials of the JA1 forms and that of the TS form are irregular. FYZH identifies the yángqù tone reading of this graph as vulgo for the word qì 徛 “stand”. Cf. Chapter V, §5.2.52.

qiān  鉛 QYS  jiwän

CDC *tshian1 ~ *ion2 (~ *khan1)

TS [ts'iĩ陰平]; WN1 [—]; WN2

[—]; WN3 [tɕ'iɛn陰平];

TC [dʑiɛn陰平文 ~ nɛn陽平白]; XZ

[—]; YX [—]; DC1 [nien陽平]; DC2 [—];

AY

[tɕ'iɛn陰平文 ~ k'an陰平白]; NC

[ȵiɔn陰去 ~ k'an陰平];

FX [ȵien陽平]; GA [—];

];

CL

[—]; PX

[uɛ̃

]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [yɛn

];

LH1 [yøn

];

LH2 [—]; JA1 [yan

陽平

陽平

陽平

JA2 [yɔn陽平];

SC [—]; LnC [yɛn陽平]; NnC1

[yɵn陽平]; NnC2

[—]; LC [viɛn陽平]

CG *nyon陽平 ~ *k'an陰平白

~ *yon陽平 ~ *ts'ien陰平

This set comprises four entirely different etyma for the word “lead (metal)”. The fourth one is clearly a northern loanword from some recent koine. The first two are probably competing popular forms, while the third may be borrowed from a medieval koine. The TC bái form appears to be related to Common Gàn *nyon陽平 in some way but cannot be regularly derived from it.

qián  錢 QYS

490

Appendix: Data

CL  [tɕ'iø陽平];

PX

[tɕ'ia陽平];

AF1  [—];  AF2  [tɕʰio陽平];  LH1

[tɕʰyo陽平];

LH2  [tɕʰio陽平];

JA1 [tɕʰio去];

JA2

[tɕ'yɔ陽平];

SC [tɕʰio陽平];

LnC [tɕ'yo陽平];

NnC1 [t'o陽平]; NnC2 [t'ɔ陽平]; LC

[k'io陽平] CG *gio陽平

It is possible that a Common Gàn form *gia陽平 should be reconstructed for the northern area. The matter is very uncertain due to the rareness of this syllable type. The JA1 tone is unexpected.

qīng  傾 QYS  khjwäng, khjäng

CDC *khing1 ~ khiung1 (?)

TS [tɕ'yɐn上]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [tɕʰyn上]; WN3 [—];

TC [dzən上];

XZ [dʑiŋ陰平];

YX [dʑʰin陰平2];

DC1 [dʑiuŋ陰平];

DC2 [iuŋ陰平];

AY

[tɕ'iŋ陰平]; NC

[tɕ'in陰平文 ~ k'iɛn陰平白]; FX

[tɕ'iɯŋ陰平];

GA [tsʰin陰平];

CL

[tɕ'ĩ陰平];

PX  [tʂ'ʯŋ上];

AF1  [tɕʰĩn上];  AF2  [tɕʰin陰平];  LH1

[tɕʰĩ陰上];

LH2

[tɕʰin陰平];

JA1 [tɕʰyn平]; JA2

[tɕʰyn陰平];

SC

[tɕʰĩ陰平];

LnC

[tɕ'iuŋ陰平]; NnC1 [tɕ'in陰平]; NnC2 [tɕ'yn陰平];

LC [k'yn陰平] CG *k'yiŋ陰平

~ *k'iŋ陰平文

The origin of the NC bái form is uncertain. The second or wén reconstruction is probably represented by the NC wén reading and the CL, LH1 and 2 and NnC1 forms. It may be a loan from some northern koine. The initial of the GA form suggests that it is derived at some stage from an earlier *k'yn陰平. See Chapter II, §2.5.2.

[—];

[tɕʰy陰上];

[tɕʰy上];

LH2

[tɕʰiu上];

JA1 [tsʰy上];

[tɕ'y上];

[t'y上] CG *ts'y陰上

The final of the LH1 form is irregular. The word is perhaps a loan from some other Gàn dialect, or even from the modern standard koine.

qù  去 QYS  khjwo-

CDC *khie5 (~ *khiu)

TS

[tɕ'y陰去文 ~ tɕ'i陰去白];

WN1

[tɕhiɛ陰去 ~ tɕhy陰去]; WN2

[tɕʰiɛ陰去]; WN3 [tɕ'iɛ陰去];

TC

[ui陰去文 ~ dʑie陰去白];

XZ [dʑiɛ陰去2]; YX [dʑʰiɛ陰去2]; DC1

[dʑi陰去 ~ dʑie陰去];

DC2 [i陰去];

AY [tɕ'iɛ上白]*; NC

[tɕ'iɛ上]; FX

[tɕ'i陰去 ~ tɕ'ie陰去]; GA [hɛ陰去文 ~ ɕiɛ陰去白];

CL

[tɕ'y陰去文 ~ tɕ'ie陰去白]; PX

[tɕ'iɛ去]; AF1 [tɕʰie去];

AF2 [tɕʰie去];

LH2 [kʰiɛ陰去]; JA1

[kʰie去]; JA2 [—];

[ɕi陰去]; LnC [tɕ'i陰去文 ~ tɕ'ie陰去白 ~ k'e陰去白]; NnC1 [k'ie陰去白]; NnC2 [k'iɛ陰去];

LC [tɕ'y陰去文

~ tɕ'iɛ陰去白 ~ k'ɛ陰去白]

CG *k'e陰去白 ~ *k'ie陰去白 ~ k'y陰去文

*The source gives no corresponding wén form.

LnC and LC preserve reflexes of all three Common Gàn forms.

rán

然 QYS

ńźjän

CDC *nhian2

陽平

]; WN1 [ȵjɛn

陽平

陽平

TS [zɛ̃

]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [iɛn

];

[lɛn陽平1];

TC [yɛn陽平]; XZ

[lən陽平]; YX

[lɛn陽平];

DC1 [len陽平];

DC2

AY [lɛŋ陽平]; NC

[lɛn陰去]; FX

[len陽平];

[lɛn陽平];

CL

[lã

陽平

陽平

];

AF1

[—]; AF2

[lɛn

陽平

陽平

]; LH2

[nen

陽平

];

JA1

]; PX [iɛ̃

]; LH1

[nẽ

[liɛn ];

JA2

[lan陽平];

SC [—]; LnC [len陽平]; NnC1

[ian陽平];

NnC2 [ian陽平文 ~ nan陽平白]; LC [iɛn陽平]

CG *nien陽平

~ *ɻien陽平文 ~ *ɻen陽平 ~ *ɻan陽平

In this complex and heavily layered set, the second and third reconstructions represent earlier and later Guānhuà period borrowings. The NnC2 bái reading conceivably derives from a very archaic form *nan陽平. The matter remains uncertain. The CL and JA2 forms probably represent a very late northern borrowing in *ɻan陽平 from the modern standard koine.

497

A Study of Comparative Gàn

rèn

任 QYS  ńźjəm-

CDC *nhim6

The WN2 form may derive from an earlier from *nim陽去, which would predate the reconstructed forms for this set.

The LH2 tone is irregular.

rèn  刃 QYS  ńźjen-

CDC *nhin6

TS [zɐn上]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [in陽去];

TC [yn上]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [lən陽去]; DC2 [—];

AY [ləm上]; NC [lən上]; FX [ləm陽去]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [iŋ去]; AF1 [—];

AF2 [lin去]; LH1 [—]; LH2 [in陰去]; JA1 [lin去]; JA2 [len陽去];

SC [—]; LnC [lin陽去]; NnC1

[—]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—] CG *ɻin陽去 ~ *ɻen陽去

The second reconstructed form has unetymological modern readings in shǎngshēng and in final -m at some points. The LH2 form irregularly has an upper register tone. The word, meaning “blade of a weapon or tool”, is learned and bookish, and perhaps consequently particularly succeptible to such anomalies.

499

A Study of Comparative Gàn

ròu

肉 QYS

ńźjuk

汝 QYS

ńźjwo:

The GA form is an entirely different etymon from that represented by the other forms in this set and corresponds to modern standard nǎi 奶.

rù  入 QYS  ńźjəp

CDC *nhip8

TS [zɿ陽去];

WN1 [jiʔ陰入];

WN2 [luʔ陽入];

WN3 [luk陰入文 ~ it陰入白];

TC [yʔⁿ]; XZ [lɛ入]; YX

[lɛʔ陰入1]; DC1

[lət陰入]; DC2

[ləl陰入2];

AY [lət陰入]; NC [lət陰入];

FX [ləp陰入]; GA [løl陰入];

CL [ʐʅ入];

PX [i陰平]; AF1 [le陰平]; AF2

[le陰平]; LH1

[le去]; LH2

[lɛ陰平];

JA1 [lei平];

JA2

[le陰平];

SC [lu陰去];

LnC [lip陰入];

NnC1 [—]; NnC2 [øyʔ]; LC [ip陰入] CG *ɻip陰入白 ~ *ɻuk陰入文

The wén layer reconstruction has an unetymological coda. It must be of very late loan provenance. Both readings show by their initial that they are not inherited from earlier stages of Common Gàn. Cf. §2.7 of Chapter II. Thus, this word for “enter” is clearly not of primary origin in Gàn.

ruì  銳 QYS  jiwäi-

SC [—]; LnC [lui陽去]; NnC1

[t'y陽去];

NnC2 [—]; LC [ly陽去]

CG *yi陽去 ~ *lyi陽去 ~ *lui陽去

The TS and LH2 forms have upper register tones, a typical marker of literary prevenance. The word itself is basically learned in all dialects.

502

Appendix: Data

SC [—]; LnC [soŋ陽去]; NnC1 [soŋ陽去]; NnC2 [—]; LC

[sɔŋ陽去] CG *ʂioŋ陽去

AF2 has an unetymological yīnshǎng reading for this syllable. It has perhaps been contaminated by association the word shàng 上. The initial of the JA1 form is irregular.

CG *sɿ陰上

The CL form in this set is probably a loan from some form of northern Guānhuà.

The WN1 tone is irregular.

*AFXZ.

The LH2 tone is irregular.

shū  書 QYS  śjwo

CDC *shie1 (~ *shiu1)

TS [ɕy陰平]; WN1

[ɕy陰平]; WN2 [ʂu陰平]; WN3 [ɕy陰平];

[ʂu陰平]; DC2

[ʂu陰平];

NC [ɕy陰平];

FX [su陰平];

GA [hø陰平];

CL [ɕy陰平];

PX [ʂʯ陰平];

AF1 [sʯ陰平];

AF2

[ɕy陰平]; LH1

[ɕy陰平];

LH2

[ɕy陰平]; JA1 [ɕy平];

JA2 [ɕy陰平];

SC [ɕy陰平];

LnC

[su陰平];

NnC1 [ɕy陰平 ~ ɕie陰平]; NnC2 [ɕiɛ陰平];

*ʂie陰平白 ~ *ʂy陰平文

517

A Study of Comparative Gàn

CL [—]; PX [ʂʯ陰平]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [ɕy陽平]; LH1 [—]; LH2 [ɕy陰平]; JA1 [sy去]; JA2 [ɕy陽平];

The JA1 tone is irregular.

shǔ  鼠 QYS  śjwo:

CDC *shie3 (~ *shiu3)

TS [ɕy上];

WN1 [ɕy上]; WN2 [ɕy上];

WN3 [ɕy上];

TC [ɕy上];

XZ [ʂu上];

YX [ʂu上]; DC1

[ʂuk陽入]*; DC2

[ʂu上];

AY [su上];

NC [ɕy上];

FX [su上]; GA

[hø上];

CL [ɕy上];

PX [ʂʯ上];

AF1 [sei陰上];

AF2 [sui陰上]; LH1

[ʂy陰上]**;

LH2 [ɕy上];

JA1 [ɕy上];

JA2 [ɕy上];

SC [ɕy陰上];

LnC [su上]; NnC1 [ɕy上];

NnC2 [ɕiɛ上]; LC

[ɕy上文 ~ ɕiɛ上白] CG *ʂie上白 ~ *ʂy陰上文

(~ *ʂyi陰上?)

*The final in this form is quite irregular.

**This is almost certainly a misprint in the source. Cf. JXFY: [ɕy陰上].

The AF1 and 2 forms are curious and deserve further study. They may represent an archaic pronunciation of the word “rat”.

shuāi  衰 QYS  ṣwi

CDC *shuei1

TS [sa陰平]; WN1 [—]; WN2

[—]; WN3 [səi陰平];

TC [sai陰平];

XZ [sai陰平]; YX

[sai陰平1]; DC1 [—]; DC2 [—];

AY

[sai陰平];

NC [sai陰平]; FX

[—]; GA [soi陰平];

CL [—]; PX [si陰平]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [sui陰平]; LH1

[ɕy陰平]; LH2

[suai陰平]; JA1 [suɔi平];

JA2

[sui陰平];

SC

[—]; LnC [sui陰平]; NnC1 [søy陰平]; NnC2 [—];

LC [soi陰平]

CG *soi陰平 ~ *suoi陰平 ~

*ʂyi陰平

The forms from TS through GA regularly point to the first reconstruction. The AF2 and LH1 forms must derive from a proto-form such as the third one, i.e., with retroflex initial and final *-yi. The remaining forms point to the second reconstruction as their origin.

shuì

睡 QYS  źjwe-

CDC *zhui6

TS [ɕyæi陰去]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [ɕy陽去]; WN3 [ɕy陽去];

TC [fi陽去文 ~ ɕy陽去白]; XZ [ʂui陽去]; YX [ɕi陽去]; DC1 [—]; DC2 [—];

AY [ɕi陽去]; NC [sui陽去]; FX [si陽去]; GA

[hø陽去];

CL

[—]; PX [ʂʯ陽平]; AF1

[fẽn去]; AF2

[—]; LH1 [ɕy陽平]; LH2 [—]; JA1

[sy去 ~ suɔi去];

JA2

[sui陽去];

SC [fẽn陰去]; LnC [sui陽去]; NnC1 [—]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—]

CG *ʂyi陽去 ~ *ʂyi陽平

The tone of the TS form is irregular. The AF1 and SC forms belong to a different etymon from that represented in the rest of the set. The XZ form appears to be a loan, perhaps from the Modern Standard koine. The expected modern reflex would be [fi] here.

[ɕiau陰平]; LC

The NnC2 final is irregular.

*suk陽入

The GA tone is irregularly of higher register. A reviewer cites for another GA variety a lower register reading.

CG *suoi陰去

~ *sui陰去 ~ *ts'uoi陰去

The third reconstructed form is unetymological but is supported by the TS and TC forms. The tone of the CL form is unexpectedly of lower register.

A Study of Comparative Gàn

tā  他 QYS  thâ

CDC *tha1

TC [da陰平]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [da陰平文]; DC2 [—];

FX [t'a陰平]; GA [—];

AF1 [tʰa陰平]; AF2 [—]; LH1

[tʰa陰平文]; LH2 [—];

JA1 [tʰa平文];

JA2 [—];

SC [—]; LnC [t'a陰平]*;

NnC1 [—]; NnC2 [—]; LC [t'a陰平]

CG *t'a陰平

*Used only in songs.

This word is probably a late loan in the Gàn dialects. In pronominal use it is found mainly in the north. More often, it is a literary word meaning “other”.

The NnC2 and LC wén forms appear to be post-Common Gàn loans from some other Gàn dialect, such as that of Nánchāng.

wài  外 QYS  ngwâi-

CDC *nguoi6

TS [ŋua陽去]; WN1 [ŋɑ陰去]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [ŋai陽去];

TC

[uai陽去文 ~ ŋai陽去白];

XZ [uai陽去]; YX [ŋai陽去]; DC1 [ŋai陽去];

DC2

[ŋai陽去];

AY [ŋai陽去];

NC [uai陽去]; FX

[ŋai陽去]; GA [ŋai陽去 ~ ŋoi陽去];

CL [væ陽去];

PX [uœ去~ ŋœ去];

AF1 [—]; AF2 [uai去]; LH1

[uœ去 ~ œ去]; LH2 [—]; JA1

[uai去]; JA2

[uai陽去];

SC

[—];

LnC

[uai陽去文 ~ ŋa陰平白]; NnC1 [uai陽去]; NnC2

[vai陽去];

LC

[uai陽去]

CG *ŋai陽去

~ *ŋoi陽去 ~ *ŋuoi陽去 ~ *ŋa (Tone ?)白 ~ *uai陽去文

The first two CG forms are probably bái in register. The CG tone of the fourth form is indeterminate. The first PX and LH2 forms derive from CG *ŋuoi陽去. The fifth form is may either a northern loan form or dirive, togerher with th Tōngshān form from yet another form, *ŋuai陽去.

wǎn  晚 QYS  mjwɒn:

CDC *mvan4/EC *monx

TS [uæ͂上文 ~ væ͂上白]; WN1 [man上 ~ wɒn上]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [van上 ~ man上];

[—]; AF2 [mã陰上]; LH1 [—]; LH2

[man上]; JA1

[uan去]; JA2

[uan上];

SC [—]; LnC [uan上]; NnC1 [uan上]; NnC2 [—]; LC [uan上] CG *man陰上 ~ *uan上文

The value yīnshǎng for the tone of the second reconstructed form is conjectural, since the necessary wén readings do not occur in our data for the dialects which are determinative for the register difference in the shǎng tone.

535

A Study of Comparative Gàn

SC [mei陽上]; LnC [ui上]; NnC1 [ui上]; NnC2 [vi上 ~ mi陰平]; LC [ui陽平 ~ mi上] CG *mi陰上白 ~ *mei陽上 (?) ~ *ui上文/*yi上文

The initial of the TC bái form is irregular. The tone of the Common Gàn form *mei cannot be confidently reconstructed, due to lack of a a regular tonal correspondence between AF2 and SC. Whether the wén form should be reconstructed as *ui or *yi is uncertain.

*JXFY: [mɛ̃

].

陽平

Línchuān has duplicate readings for both the wén and bái forms. This is attributable to variation among the informants consulted in the source. Some dialects read this word in the yīnpíng

537

A Study of Comparative Gàn

rather than the yángpíng tone.

wǒ  我 QYS  ngâ:

CDC *ngo4

TS [ŋɒ上];

WN1 [ŋɔ上]; WN2

[ŋo上]; WN3

[ŋo上]; DC2

[ŋɔ上];

[ŋɔ上]; FX [ŋo陽去];

];

PX [hɔ̃ ~ ŋɔ ];

AF1 [ŋo

];

AF2 [o

]; LH1 [uo

陰平

陽上

陽上

陽上

陽去

[ŋo上]; JA2

[ŋɔ上];

SC [ŋai陽上];

LnC [ŋo上];

NnC1 [ŋo上 ~ a陰平]; NnC2 [a陰平];

LC [ŋo上文 ~ *a陰平白]

CG *ŋa

(Tone ?)白 (?) ~ *ŋo陽上

The TS and LC bái forms, together with the two Nánchéng forms having final -a, appear to descend from our reconstructed bái form, but NnC and LC irregularly lose initial ŋ-. The SC form looks very archaic and “Hakka-like”. Whether it is an ancient retention from an old substrate, or simply a Hakka loan, is indeterminate.

wò  臥 QYS  nguâ-

*JXFY.

The AF2 tone is irregular.

[—]; LC [u陽平] CG *u陽平

*JXFY.

This syllable is a literary word. The WN1 form, perhaps derived from an earlier *ŋ̩上, appears to be an archaic existential negative rather than a direct cognate to the other forms in this set.

543

A Study of Comparative Gàn

AY [hat陰入]; NC [hat陰入]; FX [hat陰入]; GA [hal陰入];

CL [xa入]; PX [ha陰平]; AF1 [hɛ陰平]; AF2 [hɛ陰平]; LH1 [he陰平]; LH2 [hɛ陰平]; JA1 [hɛ平]; JA2 [xɛ陰平];

SC [ha陰去]; LnC [hat陰入]; NnC1 [haiʔ入]; NnC2 [haiʔ入]; LC [haiʔ陰入] CG *hat陰入白 (~ *hiat陰入文 ?)

The wén reconstruction can only be conjectured, since it is supported only in TC. It may in fact be a very late loan, borrowed as *hiaʔ入 from some some of Guānhuà.

[ɕiẽ去]; LH2 [ɕiɛ陰去]; JA1 [ɕyan去];

JA2 [ɕyɔn陽去];

SC [ɕyõn陽去];

[sɔn陽去]; LC

[fiɛn陽去]

CG *hyon陽去

*JXFY.

The initial of the LC form is unexpected. The form may ultimately be a loan of some sort, perhaps from a dialect that reads ts'iɔŋ陽去 (an impossible syllable in LC).

xiē  些 QYS  sja

CDC *sia1

TS [si入]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [ɕiɛʔ陰入]; WN3 [ɕiɛt陰入];

TC [ɕie陰平文 ~ ɕia陰平白]; XZ

[sie陰平]; YX [ʂɛʔ陰入1]; DC1 [—]; DC2 [—];

AY [—]; NC [ɕiɛt陰入]; FX

[ɕie陰平]; GA [—];

CL  [ɕiɛ入];

PX [si] no tone;

AF1 [—];  AF2 [ɕie陰平];  LH1 [ɕie陰平];

LH2

[ɕiɛ陰平];

JA1

[—]; JA2 [—];

SC [—]; LnC [ɕie陰平]; NnC1 [ɕie陰平]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—] CG *sie陰平 ~ *ʂiet陰入 (~ *sia陰平) The TC bái form, which probably derives from earlier *sia陰平, is not really reconstructable comparatively in Common Gàn because it is attested only at this point, though we can hypothesize that it existed. The form *ʂiet陰入, which is unetymological, is on the contrary well supported by comparative evidence.

xiè  謝 QYS  zja-

CDC *zia6

TS [si陽去]; WN1

[tɕjɑ陽去];

WN2 [dzia陽去*initial should surely be palatal]; WN3

[dʑia陽去];

TC [dʑie陽去文 ~ dʑia陽去白]; XZ [sia陽去]; YX

[ɕia陽去 ~ dʑʰia陽去]; DC1

[dʑia陽去]; DC2

[dzia陰平];

AY [ɕia陽去]; NC

[ɕia陽去文 ~ tɕ'ia陽去白];

FX

[ɕie陽去文 ~ tɕie陽去白]; GA

[sia陽去 ~ tsʰia陽去];

CL [ɕie陽去]; PX

[sia去]; AF1 [ɕia去];

AF2

[ɕia去]; LH1

[ɕia去]; LH2 [ɕia陽去]; JA1 [ɕia去];

JA2 [ɕia陽去];

SC [ɕia陽去]; LnC

[ɕia陽去文 ~ tɕ'ia陽去白];

NnC1

[tɕ'ia陽去]; NnC2 [ɕia陽去文 ~ tɕ'ia陽去白];

LC [ɕia陽去

~ t'ia陽去] CG *dzia陽去白 ~ *sia陽去文 ~ *sie陽去 The bái form is probably the archaic, native Gàn etymon. The first wén form corresponds

directly to the QYS reading and is probably an early loan from some medieval koine. The third reconstructed form is clearly a late loan from the north. The initial of the TC wén reading may be a contamination from the bái form.

xíng  行 QYS  ɣɒng

CDC *hang2

TS [ɕin陽平]; WN1 [—]; WN2

[—]; WN3 [ɕin陽平];

];

DC2 [ɕiŋ

｀];

TC [ɕin

]; XZ

[ɕiŋ

]; YX

[ɕin

];

DC1 [ɕiŋ

陽平

陽平

陽平

陽平

陽平

AY [ɕiŋ陽平]; NC

[ɕin陰去]; FX

[ɕiən陽平];

GA [ɕin陽平];

CL [ɕĩ陽平];

PX [ɕin陽平]; AF1 [—]; AF2

[ɕiŋ陽平]; LH1

[ɕĩ陽平 ~ hẽ陽平];

LH2 [ɕin陽平 ~ hen陽平];

JA1 [ɕin上]; JA2 [—];

SC [—]; LnC [hen陽平]; NnC1

[hen陽平];

NnC2 [haŋ陽平]; LC [ɕin陽平文 ~ haŋ陽平白] CG *haŋ陽平白

~ *hiŋ陽平文 ~ *hen陽平 (?)

The CG form reconstructed for this set as *hen陽平 should perhaps really be restored as *heŋ陽平, but this form is not reconstructable comparatively, because the appropriate reading does not happen to occur in the dialects that would support final *-eŋ here. The second one, and perhaps also the third, represents a different etymon, meaning “to do, carry out”, whereas the first one means “to walk”.

550

Appendix: Data

xǐng

醒 QYS

sieng:

CDC *siang3

~ ɕiɑŋ

];

TS [sin

~ siæ̃  ]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [ɕiaŋ ]; WN3 [ɕin

上文

上白

上文

上白

NnC2  [ɕiuŋ陰平文 ~ saŋ陰平白];  LC

[fiaŋ陰平]

CG *hyaŋ陰平白 ~ *hiuŋ陰平文

The wén and bái forms for Píngxiāng are mistakenly inverted in the source, as can be determined by referring to the lexical section of the work. We have corrected this here.

551

A Study of Comparative Gàn

552

Appendix: Data

JA2 [ɕy陰平];

SC [—]; LnC [si陰平]; NnC1 [ɕy陰平]; NnC2 [—]; LC [ɕy陰平] CG *sy陰平

The TS bái form is the regular reflex of CG *sy陰平. The wén form has probably been borrowed from elsewhere in fairly recent times.

xū  虛 QYS  xjwo

CDC *xie1 (~ *xiu1)

TS [ɕy陰平]; WN1 [ɕy陰平]; WN2 [ɕy陰平]; WN3 [ɕy陰平];

TC [ɕy陰平];

XZ [hʉi陰平];

YX [ɕi陰平1]; DC1 [—]; DC2

[ɕi陰平];

AY [ɕi陰平];

NC [ɕy陰平];

FX [ɕi陰平]; GA [hø陰平];

CL [ɕy陰平];

PX [ʂʯ陰平];

AF1 [sʮ陰平]; AF2 [ɕy陰平]; LH1 [ɕy陰平];

LH2 [ɕy陰平]; JA1 [ɕy平];

JA2 [ɕy陰平];

SC [ɕy陰平];

LnC [ɕi陰平];

NnC1 [ɕy陰平]; NnC2 [ɕy陰平];

LC [hy陰平文 ~ hɛ陰平白] CG *hy陰平

The LC bái form may derive from an archaic form in *he陰平. We unfortunately have nothing in our data set with which to compare it.

xú  徐 QYS  zjwo

CDC *zie2 (~ *ziu2)

TS [ɕy陽平文 ~ sæi陽平白]; WN1

[tɕy陽平]; WN2 [dʑy陽平]; WN3

[dʑy陽平];

TC [dʑi陽平]; XZ

[dzi陽平]; YX

[dʑʰi陽平];

DC1 [dzi陽平]; DC2

[dzi陽平2];

AY [tɕ'i陽平]; NC

[tɕ'y陽平]; FX

[tɕ'i陽平];

GA [tsʰi陽平];

CL [ɕy陽平]; PX [si陽平]; AF1

[sʮ陽平]; AF2

[ɕy陽平];

LH1

[ɕiu陽平];

LH2

[ɕiu陽平]; JA1 [sy上];

JA2 [ɕy陽平];

SC [ɕy陽平]; LnC

[si陽平文 ~ ts'e陽平白]; NnC1

[t'ie陽平];

NnC2

[t'iɛ陽平];

LC

[t'ɛ陽平] CG *dzie陽平 ~

*sy陽平文 ~ *dzy陽平

The LnC bái form is problematic and requires further study. It is possible that early *-ie was reduced to -e after sibilants in LnC. The TS bái form must derive from an earlier *si陽平, which is the regular reflex of *-y in this environment. The wén form presumably derives from a very late loan form, *sy陽平. The AF1 form is anomalous. Its final -ʯ requires derivation from a Common Gàn initial *ʂ- syllable (i.e., *ʂy陽平), for which there is no evidence in the other representative dialects.

xǔ  許 QYS

xjwo:

[fi上]; YX [ɕi上]; DC1

xù  序 QYS

zjwo:

CDC *zie4 (~ *ziu4)

TS [sæi陽去]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [ɕy陽去];

553

A Study of Comparative Gàn

TC [ɕi陽去]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [si陽去]; DC2 [—]; AY [ɕi陽去]; NC [ɕy陽去]; FX [si陽去]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [si去]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [ɕy去]; LH1 [—]; LH2 [ɕy陰去]; JA1 [sy去]; JA2 [ɕy陽去]; SC [—]; LnC [si陽去]; NnC1 [ɕy陽去]; NnC2 [—]; LC [ɕy陽去] CG *sy陽去

The LH2 final is irregular, for we would expect final -iu here. The form is probably borrowed from some other Gàn dialect, or even from the modern standard koine.

xù  蓄, 畜 QYS

xjuk  “to breed, raise”

CDC *xiuk7

TS [ɕiu入]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3

[ɕiuk陰入];

[ɕiu入]; YX [ɕiuʔ陰入1];

[ɕiuk陰入1];

[ɕiuk陰入];

FX [ɕiəuʔ陰入文 ~ t'uʔ陰入白];

GA [tsʰuʔ陰入];

CL [ɕy入]; PX [ɕy陰平]; AF1

[—]; AF2 [ɕio陰平]; LH1

[ɕyo陰平];

LH2 [ɕio陰平]; JA1

[ɕio平];

JA2 [ɕyə陰平];

SC [—]; LnC [ɕiuʔ陰入]; NnC1 [ɕiuʔ陰入];

NnC2 [ɕiuʔ陰入]; LC

[hiuʔ陰入]

CG *hiuk陰入

The FX bái form and the GA form are contaminations from the reading chù 畜 “livestock”. The initial of the first DC1 form is irregular. The second form is specifically designated as yòu 又 “alternate” in the source.

xù 絮 QYS  sjwo- CDC *sie5 (~ *siu5)

TS [sæi陰去]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [ɕy陰去];

TC [ɕi陰去]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [si陰去]; DC2 [—];

CG *sie陰去白 ~ *sy陰去文

~ *sy陽去

The tone of the the third reconstructed form is unetymological.

xuē  靴 QYS  xuâ

CDC *xiuo1

TS [ɕiɒ陰平];

WN1 [ɕja陰平];

WN2 [ɕia陰平];

WN3 [ɕia陰平];

TC [—]; XZ [hʉia陰平]; YX

[fia陰平1]; DC1

[ɕia陰平]; DC2 [ɕia陰平];

AY [ɕia陰平];

NC [ɕyɛ陰平文 ~ ɕia陰平白]; FX

[ɕie陰平]; GA

[ɕio陰平];

CL [ɕya陰平];

PX [fɛ陰平]; AF1 [ɕiœ陰平];

AF2 [ɕio陰平];

LH1 [ɕya陰平];

LH2 [ɕya陰平]; JA1

[ɕio平]; JA2

[ɕyɔ陰平];

SC [ɕio陰平]; LnC [ɕyo陰平]; NnC1 [so陰平]; NnC2 [sɔ陰平]; LC [hio陰平] CG *hyo陰平 (~ *hya陰平?) It is possible that a Common Gàn form *hya陰平 should be reconstructed for the northern area. The syllable type is unique and difficult to reconstruct with confidence. The NC wén reading is clearly a late northern loan, probably from the modern standard koine or its immediate precursors.

554

Appendix: Data

NnC2

[ɕin陰去文 ~ tɕ'in陽平白]; LC

[t'im陽平] CG

555

A Study of Comparative Gàn

*dzim陽平白 ~ *sim陽平文

The tone of the NnC2 wén form is irregular. The WN2 form may be a misprint in the source. The second Xīngzǐ form is the vernacular word for “search” in this dialect. Neither of our reconstructions accounts for it.

xùn  訓 QYS  xjuən-

*JXFY.

The initial of the LH2 form is anomalous. The final of the AY form is irregular. We would expect -ai here.

LC [niam陽平]

CG *ŋɔ(n)陽平白

~ *niam陽平文

The tone of the NC bái form is irregular. YX has a regular tone reading for this same form. The reconstruction should perhaps have final *-m rather than *-n, but there is no direct evidence for this in the data.

The JA2 tone is irregular.

CG *in陰平

*JXFY.

The LC final nasal is tonally conditioned, i.e., *-n > -ŋ under Tone 1 in the presence of initial zero.

566

Appendix: Data

SC [—]; LnC [iuŋ陽平]; NnC1 [iuŋ陽平]; NnC2 [iuŋ陽平]; LC [iuŋ陽平] CG *yaŋ陽平 ~ *iuŋ陽平 The Chálíng form in this set probably supports the first reconstruction. Examples of this syllable type are quite rare in the data.

yìng  硬 QYS  ngɛng-

CDC *ngang6

TS [ŋæ͂陽去]; WN1

[ŋɑŋ陽去];

WN2 [ŋaŋ陽去]; WN3 [ŋɑŋ陽去];

TC [ŋaŋ陽去]; XZ

[ŋaŋ陽去]; YX [ŋaŋ陽去]; DC1

[ŋaŋ陽去];

DC2 [ŋaŋ陽去];

AY [ŋaŋ陽去]; NC

[ŋaŋ陽去];

FX [ŋaŋ陽去白]; GA

[ŋaŋ陽去];

CL [ŋẽ陽去]; PX [ŋã去]; AF1

[ŋãŋ去]; AF2 [ŋaŋ陽平]; LH1

[ã去];

LH2 [ŋan陰去];

JA1 [ŋiɛn去];

JA2

[ŋen陽去文 ~ ŋaŋ陽去白];

SC

[ŋã陽去];  LnC

[ŋen陽去文 ~ ŋaŋ陽去白];  NnC1

[ŋaŋ陽去];

NnC2

[ŋaŋ陽去];  LC

[ŋaŋ陽去]  CG

*ŋaŋ陽去白 ~ *ŋen陽去文

Though one may guess that the wén reading of this word actually had final *-ŋ, our data do not provide direct evidence for this final element.

The AF2 tone is irregular.

yǒng  勇 QYS  jiwong:

CDC *yung4

TS [iɐŋ上]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [iŋ上];

TC [in上]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [iuŋ上]; DC2 [—];

AY [iŋ上]; NC [iuŋ上]; FX [iɯŋ上]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [iŋ上]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [in陰上]; LH1 [—];

LH2 [yŋ上]; JA1 [iəŋ上]; JA2 [yŋ上];

SC [—]; LnC [iuŋ上];

NnC1 [iuŋ上]; NnC2 [—]; LC

[iuŋ上]

CG *iuŋ陰上

yǒng  永 QYS  jwɒng:

CDC *wing4 ~ *wiung4

TS [yɐn上]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [—]; WN3 [in上];

TC [yn上];

XZ [iŋ上];

YX [vin上];

DC1 [iuŋ上]; DC2

[iuŋ上];

AY [iŋ上];

NC [yn上];

FX [iɯŋ上];

GA [øn上];

CL [yŋ上文 ~ yẽ上白]; PX [ʯŋ上];

AF1 [—];

AF2 [in陰上]; LH1 [yẽ陰上]; LH2

[yøn上]; JA1

[yn上]; JA2

[yn上];

SC [—]; LnC [iuŋ上];

NnC1 [yn上]; NnC2

[yn上]; LC [vin上]

CG *yiŋ陰上

The CL wén form is interesting. It is perhaps a loan from some dialect that realizes this word as [yŋ上].

yòng  用 QYS  jiwong-

CDC *yung6

TS [iɐŋ陽去];

WN1 [joŋ陽去];

WN2 [iəŋ陽去];

WN3 [iŋ陽去];

TC [in陽去];

569

A Study of Comparative Gàn

yú  魚 QYS  ngjwo

CDC *ngie2 (~ *ngiu2)

TS [ȵy陽平]; WN1 [ȵy陽平];

WN2 [ȵy陽平]; WN3 [ȵy陽平];

TC [ny陽平]; XZ

[ȵiɛ陽平]; YX

[ȵiɛ陽平]; DC1 [ni陽平];

DC2 [ȵi陽平1];

AY [ȵiɛ陽平]; NC

[ȵiɛ陰去];

FX

[ȵi陽平文~ ȵie陽平白];

GA

[ø陽平];

CL  [ŋ陽平];  PX

[ʯ陽平文 ~ ɳʯ陽平 ~ ŋɛ陽平白];

AF1

[ŋ陽平];  AF2

[ŋ陽平];

LH1  [y陽平文 ~ ŋ陽平白];

LH2 [ŋ陽平]; JA1

[ŋ去]; JA2 [y陽平];

SC [ȵy陽平]; LnC [ȵi陽平文~ ȵie陽平白]; NnC1

[nie陽平];

NnC2 [ȵiɛ陽平文 ~ ŋiɛ陽平白];

LC [niɛ陽平]

CG *ŋie陽平白 ~ *ny陽平文

In this set, we assume that the bái form *ŋie陽平 has been reduced to ŋɛ陽平 in PX, and further to a syllabic nasal in most of its neighboring dialects except JA2, where the wén form has been adopted for the word “fish”. In most other dialects that retain Common Gàn *ŋie陽平, the initial becomes a coronal, either palatal or dental. NnC2 has, on the contrary, retained the Common Gàn form nearly unchanged as its ordinary word for “fish”; but it has borrowed a bái-derived form ȵiɛ陽平 from some other Gàn dialect, probably NC, as its wén reading.

yú  逾 QYS  jiu

TC [—]; XZ [—]; YX [—]; DC1 [i陽平]; DC2 [—];

AY [ui陽平]; NC [—]; FX [i陽平]; GA [—];

CL [—]; PX [—]; AF1 [—]; AF2 [y陽平]; LH1 [—]; LH2

[y陽平]; JA1

[y去]; JA2

[y陽平];

SC [—]; LnC [i陽平]; NnC1 [y陽平]; NnC2 [—]; LC [y上] CG *y陽平

The tone of the LC form is irregular.

[iuʔ入]; LC [hiuʔ陰入] CG *iuk陰入

*JXFY.

The NC and LC initials are irregular. The CL and SC forms should derive from a yángrù form.

yù  玉 QYS  ngjwok

CDC *ngiuk8

TS [y陽去]; WN1 [—]; WN2 [ȵiuʔ陰入]; WN3 [y陰去 ~ ȵiuk陰入];

TC [yʔ入]; XZ [niu入]; YX [viʔ陽入/iuʔ陰入1]; DC1

[niuk陰入]; DC2

[niuk陰入1];

AY [ȵiuʔ陰入]; NC [y陽去 ~ ȵiuk陰入舊]; FX [ȵiuʔ陰入]; GA [ø陽去];

571

A Study of Comparative Gàn

CL [y陽去]; PX

[ȵʯ去 ~ ȵiu陰平];

AF1 [ȵio陰平];

AF2 [nio陰平];

LH1 [yo陰平]*; LH2 [io陰平];

JA1 [ny去]; JA2

[yə陰平];

SC [y陽去]; LnC

[ȵiuʔ陰入]; NnC1

[niuʔ入]; NnC2

[ȵiuʔ入]; LC

[niuʔ陰入] CG *niuk陰入 ~ *y陽去

*JXFY: [io陰平].

The second reconstruction is clearly a loan from the modern standard koine or its proximate precursors. Some forms, such as the first PX reading and the JA1 form may also derive from earlier *-yʔ final syllables, having a final which is not regularly reconstructable in the Common Gàn system. These probably represent loan readings of some sort.

CG *yon陽平

*JXFY.

The wén form in the LH1 is an etymon meaning “round”. It is not related to the other forms in this set. The YX tone is irregular.

~ *dzai陽去文

*Neutral tone. This syllable occurs only in compounds. It is not the ordinary locative verb in this dialect.

The JA2 form irregularly lacks aspiration.

[tan陰去];

SC

[tsãn陽去];

LnC [ten陰去]; NnC1 [tɵn陰去]; NnC2

[tɔn陰去];

LC [tɕiɛn陰去]

CG *tʂien陰去

The WN2 form appears to be a loan, probably from southern Mandarin.

579

A Study of Comparative Gàn

JA2 [tsan陽去];

SC [tsãn陽去]; LnC [tsan陰去]**; NnC1 [—]; NnC2 [—]; LC [—] CG *tsan陰去 *JXFY.

**This is not a spoken form for “to stand” in this dialect. It is uncertain in the source whether this reading represents the sense “to stand” or is the late loanword “station”.

581

A Study of Comparative Gàn

CL [tse陰平文 ~ tsa陰平白]; PX

[tʂa陰平];

AF1 [ta陰平]; AF2 [ta陰平]; LH1 [tsa陰平]; LH2 [tsa陰平];

JA1 [ʈa平];

JA2 [tsa陰平];

SC [tsa陰平];

LnC [ta陰平];

NnC1 [ta陰平]; NnC2 [ta陰平];

LC [tsa陰平] CG *tʂia陰平白 (~ *tʂie陰平文)

The CL wén form probably derives from an early borrowed *tʂie陰平. Note that the final of the FX form is the regular reflex of Common Gàn *-ia in this position.

The TS tone is irregular.

zhé

摘 QYS  ṭɛk

CDC *cak7

[tsak陰入];

[tsaʔ陰入]; NC [tsak陰入]; FX

[tseʔ陰入文 ~ tsaʔ陰入白]; GA [tsaʔ陰入];

CL

[tse入文 ~ tsa入白]; PX [tsa陰平]; AF1 [tsa陰平]; AF2

[tsa陰平]; LH1

[tsa陰平];

LH2 [tsɛ陰平];

JA1

[tsa平]; JA2 [tsa陰平];

SC [tsa陰去]; LnC [tsaʔ陰入]; NnC1 [tsaʔ入]; NnC2 [tsaʔ入]; LC [tsaʔ陰入] CG *tsak陰入白 ~ *tsek陰入文 The DC1 form is unexpectedly retroflexed. The set as a whole is not consistent with those normally reflecting CG retroflexes.

JA2

The third reconstructed form shows an archaic retention of an initial dental stop. It is supported by the LH1, LH2 and SC forms.

The second reconstructed form is based on the readings found in AF1 and 2, LH2, JA1 and 2, and SC. This appears to be an archaic substrate survival in these dialects.

[tɕ'y陰平];

LC  [tɕ'y陰平]  CG *dʐy陽上 ~

*dʐy陽去 ~ *ʂy陽上

The third reconstruction is suggested by the AF and LH2 forms. The NnC1 tone is irregularly of higher register.

The initial if the DC1 form is irregular. It appears to be directly comparable to the Common Dialectal Chinese and QYS forms.

The AF2 tone is irregular.

Appendix: Data

AY [tɕi陰平]; NC [tsui陰平]; FX [tɕi陰平]; GA [—];

The AF forms are probably loans from a prestigious source such as Nánchāng. The expected AF reflexes here would have modern -y. The TC initial is unexpected.

[tsœ去];  LH2

[tsøi陰去];

JA1

[tsuɔi去]; JA2

[tsui陰去];

SC  [tɕy陽去];

LnC

[tsui陰去];  NnC1  [tɕy陰去];

NnC2  [tɕy陰去];

LC  [tɕy陰去]

CG *tsuoi陰去 ~

*tsui陰去

The SC tone is irregular.

The initial of the AF2 form is irregular. We should expect no aspiration.

595

A Study of Comparative Gàn

zūn  尊 QYS  tsuən

CDC *tsun1

TS [tsɐn陰平];

*JXFY.

zuó  昨 QYS

dzâk

~ *dzo陽去文

The tones of the LC bái form and the NnC2 form are irregular.

Appendix: Data

zuò  作 QYS  tsâk

CDC *tsok7

TS [tsø陰去]; WN1 [—]; WN2

[tsoʔ陰入]; WN3 [tsok陰入];

TC [tsoʔ入];

XZ [tsɔ入]; YX

[tsɔʔ陰入1]; DC1 [tsok陰入]; DC2 [tsɔk陰入1];

AY [tsɔʔ陰入]; NC [tsɔk陰入];

FX [tsoʔ陰入]; GA [tsoʔ陰入];

CL [tso入]; PX [tsɔ陰平]; AF1 [tso陰平]; AF2

[tso陰平]; LH1

[tso陰平]; LH2

[tso陰平]; JA1 [tso平];

JA2 [tsɔ陰平];

SC [tso陰去];

LnC [tsoʔ陰入];

NnC1 [tsoʔ入];

NnC2 [tsɔʔ入];

LC [tsɔʔ陰入]

CG *tsok陰入

zuò  做 QYS  (tsuo-, tsâ-)

CDC *tso5 ~ *tsu5

TS [tsɑu陰去];

WN1 [tsu陰去];

WN2 [tsu陰去];

WN3 [tsu陰去];

TC [tsɿ陰去文 ~ tsou陰去白]; XZ

[tsɿ陰去1]; YX [tsɿ陰去1]; DC1

[tsu陰去]; DC2

[tsu陰去];

AY [tsə陰去];

NC [tsu陰去]; FX

[tsu陰去]; GA

[tsu陰去];

CL [tsu陰去];

PX [tsu去]; AF1

[tsu去]; AF2

[tsu去]; LH1

[tsu去]; LH2 [tsu陰去]; JA1 [tsəu去];

JA2 [tsu陰去];

SC [tso陽去]; LnC [—]; NnC1

[tsɿ陰去]; NnC2 [tsɿ陰去]; LC

[tsu陰去] CG *tsu陰去白 ~ tsɿ陰去文

The JA1 form is irregular. It is perhaps a loan from some prestigious dialect, such as that of Nánchāng.

597
